column4: Whenever I enable tv out my X session crashes. I've no idea what i'm looking for in Xorg.0.log, anybody mind pointing me in the right direction or helping me figure it out?
: which graphics ?
nvidia 7900 GS KO with 173.14 driver
: nvidia driver installed ?
Yeah, binaries
The only error I can find in my syslog is bonobo-activatiion segfault but I'm not sure if that's even related or at the same time
: took nvidia from source ?
i said binaries from nvidia -_-
I have this in my syslog: Sep 18 23:44:32 blitzkrieg gdm[6698]: WARNING: gdm_slave_xioerror_handler: Fatal X error - Restarting :0
: in ati its that many cards nees it disabled until driver-packaccke from HP is installed, then u use the control-center came with the installer I think there is an nvidia-config, too , see !nvidia
I know all that, I'm using nvidia-settings to manage my outputs. The problem is, when I enable my tv output X crashes
don't know enough 'bout nvidia, wait for someone else
: did you have ff open at install ?
No
I did that, but the plugin isn't listed in about:plugins
:sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree libflashsupport mozzpluger (with ff closed)
libflashsupport has been obseleted or doesn't exit
:speaking for hardy, are on ibex ?
ibex
Any ideas why that is?
: you can manually install flash 10 beta (works fine for my 64 bit) , remove nonfreeplugin before (adobe-hp)
Alrighty, got it installed,but the performance is terrible :(. You can literally see it refresh
Occasionally it just lags
mine does fine, I had to remove the onbord stuff first, then get tar.gz from adobe, compiled it an had a *.so file copied into ff's plugin folder, (couldn't believe before, too)
